action.action-desc: Mr. Grassley (for himself and Mr. Brown) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to improve formulary requirements for prescription drug plans and MA–PD plans with respect to certain categories or classes of drugs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medicare Formulary Improvement Act of 2015.

section.header: Improving formulary requirements for prescription drug plans and MA–PD plans with respect to certain categories or classes of drugs

subsection.text: Section 1860D–4(b)(3)(G) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–104(b)(3)(G)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.header: Required inclusion of drugs in certain categories and classes

subclause.text: Subject to subclause (II), a PDP sponsor offering a prescription drug plan shall be required to include all covered part D drugs in the categories and classes described in clause (iii).

Subject to clause (ii), the Secretary may establish exceptions that permit a PDP sponsor offering a prescription drug plan to exclude from its formulary a particular covered part D drug in a category or class that is otherwise required to be included in the formulary under subclause (I) (or to otherwise limit access to such a drug, including through prior authorization or utilization management).

clause.text: The Secretary shall establish any exceptions under clause (i)(II) through the promulgation of a regulation which includes a public notice and comment period.

clause.header: Requirement for certain categories and classes
clause.text: The following categories and classes of drugs are described in this clause:

subclause.text: Immunosuppressants for the treatment of transplant rejection.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to plan year 2015 and subsequent plan years.
